name: Crowne Plaza Hotel Canberra

reviews.text: We booked a family package at the Crowne Plaza through Wotif which included 2 movies and full buffet breakfast.
reviews.title: Loved the Crowne Plaza
Forget about the Parking being orgainsed!!! jeez
reviews.text: The room newly renovated room on the 5th Floor was spacious and modern with LCD TV and white bed linen. The room overlooked the street but also had views to Glebe Park.

The breakfast each morning was served in the Red Salt restaurant overlooking the park until 11am on weekends. There was an excellent selection of the usual cereal and fruit as well as nuts and gourmet breads. On the first morning they even had a blender to make smoothees. The hot food selection very good including eggs benedict and they had a Chef cooking eggs and omletes to order. There was a barista serving compilmentary coffee including Lattes and Cuppacinos.
reviews.title: Rooms look good

likes.disliked: — the noise from the Taxi rank

reviews.text: All the staff were very friendly.
reviews.title: One word - "Excellent"

reviews.text: We drove to Kingston for dinner at Vascos on the Saturday night.
reviews.title: Not just for high rollers

likes.liked: — Location, cleanliness, room service, flat screen TV, gym, breakfast buffet
likes.disliked: — 1/ Small size of the Superior room; I'd choose a Deluxe. 2/ Being grilled by a receptionist about how many minutes ago I checked in.

reviews.text: This hotel is all the things the previous positve reviews mention - it's central, with good facilities, friendly knowledgable staff and they know how to run conferences and events very professionally, better than many 5 star hotels I have experienced. I would use them again in a heart beat for business purposes and dining.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great staff, but won't stay here again...

reviews.text: But I wouldn't stay here again and if they asked me, I would dissuade my colleagues from choosing to rest their heads here too. Why?
reviews.title: Egg-cellent!!!

likes.liked: — The friendly service and renovated rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because for a room (a King) that is normally charged out at approximately $190, on the night of the Australian Federal Budget announcement when hotel rooms are in hot demand in Australia's capital city, I was charged $460.
reviews.title: Always Enjoyable - Just Lovely!

likes.liked: — The location, staff and new decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped here for 2 nights during our Australian Honeymoon. As I am also a Platinum Card Holder with the hotel's loyalty programme, I was hoping to be offered some benefits.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Upon checking in, when my status was noticed, we were begrudgingly offered an upgrade to a suite for one night only, as the hotel was full for the second night, or an upgraded room for both nights.
reviews.title: A Pleasure to Stay At in Every Way *****

reviews.text: We took the upgraded room option as we did not fancy hauling our bags around again.
reviews.title: Comfortable play to stay

reviews.text: (Please note that if the hotels are full with this group, then you receive no further benefits for being a platinum card holder as I have discovered many a time)
reviews.title: A well appointed hotel
Excellent service
reviews.text: For an upgraded room it was OK. The rooms have recently been updated, and as mentioned before on this website, the bed faces out towards the window, with the desk behind the bed. There was a large 32" plasma TV which could be slightly angled if you were viewing from the bed or desk.

The Crowne Plaza was selected for 3 nights due to the close proximity of the Conference Centre. We first had room 262, overlooking the hotel veranda, not a good view. Room was very clean and comfortable, no complaints there. Seeing we were staying for the weekend and had a separate booking for that I asked to change rooms for one overlooking the park. Room 314... exactly the same layout, 2 double beds etc. Better view and very glad we moved as the Binara Bar was in full swing on the Fri and Sat nights, I would imagine that we would have been able to hear it if we stayed in the other room. So maybe worth asking for a room at the other end if you are a light sleeper!
reviews.title: Great location, great staff

likes.liked: — Block out blinds, able to open the windows for fresh air

reviews.text: The staff at all times were most courteous and helpful, quite talkative and nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: Very disappointed and would not recommend for tourist

reviews.text: The hotel is a short walk from the large shopping centre where you could wander for hours, restaurants and cafes close by as well.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Also an easy walk to the Australian War Memorial where we spent quite a few hours.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Canberra is a great place, clean and safe... the Crowne was a good choice and would stay there again. The Seafood Buffet on the Fri and Sat nights at $69 per head was well patronised but not by us...
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

description: Encounter friendly service, easy accessibility and all the amenities you’ll need to stay connected at Crowne Plaza Canberra. Ideally located in the heart of the Nation’s Capital and within walking distance of the city’s best bars, restaurants, attractions and main shopping fair, Crowne Plaza Canberra is the accommodation venue of choice for those seeking a memorable experience. Each of our 295 luxurious rooms have been designed with comfort in mind and feature ergonomic workstations and deluxe bedding to ensure you are well rested during your holiday or business stay. Excite your palate with succulent grills and fresh local produce in our signature Redsalt Restaurant, or enjoy lighter fare and a selection of wine, beer and specialty cocktails in our vibrant and popular Binara one bar. Meet with friends or hold an informal meeting with colleagues in the picturesque Atrium Lounge and enjoy an espresso coffee or herbal tea prepared by one of our expert baristas. Being active is a big part of enjoying life, which is why we’re pleased to offer guests complimentary access to Pro-Fit Health Club with sauna and outdoor pool. Guests may also take advantage of our 24 hour Business Centre, high speed broadband and wireless connectivity in public areas designed to keep you connected. Treat yourself to a refreshing sanctuary from the stresses of life at Earth Day Spa. A visit to the spa will leave you feeling relaxed, soothed and pampered, so you can get more out of your stay. Earth Day Spa is open seven days a week and features treatments such as massages, facials, and beauty treatments for men and women. Be confident in your decision to experience Crowne Plaza Canberra and rely on exemplary service, easy access and modern facilities designed with your comfort and enjoyment in mind.
